title: Cold War: Ideological Conflict and Global Tensions

vocab.definition: Period of geopolitical tension between US and Soviet Union (1947-1991)
Political and ideological barrier between Western and Eastern Europe
US strategy to prevent spread of communism
Prevention of war through threat of nuclear retaliation
Conflict where superpowers support opposing sides without direct confrontation

teachingNotes: Analyze the ideological differences and global impact of Cold War tensions. Examine proxy conflicts and their consequences.

sample.question: What was the period of tension between US and Soviet Union?

truefalse.question: Containment was the US strategy to prevent spread of communism.

multiplechoice.question: What prevented war through threat of nuclear retaliation?

fillintheblank.question: The barrier between Western and Eastern Europe was called the ________ curtain.

shortanswer.question: How did the Cold War affect global politics?
